question.body: Which of the following statements is true of filtration?

multiple_choice.choice: It requires a concentration gradient for molecules to move from an area of higher concentration to a lower concentration.
It only allows the movement of waste products to pass.
It requires a pressure gradient for molecules to move from an area of higher pressure to a lower pressure.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Filtration does not require ATP, it is an example of a passive process.
Incorrect. Since it is a passive process, it does require a gradient but not a concentration gradient like diffusion.
Incorrect. It is nonselective â€“ this means it cannot determine what passes, remember molecules only pass based on size and pressure.
Correct. Even though filtration is a passive process and does not require ATP it does need some sort of gradient to move the molecules.
